level.heading: RESPONSES TO INTERPRETATION OR ENFORCEMENT PETITIONS (ยง 15-2623)

level.text: A party to the approved agreement that is the subject of the interpretation or enforcement proceeding may file a response to the interpretation or enforcement petition. An original and fifteen (15) copies of the response shall be filed with the Commission Secretary within twenty-five (25) calendar days of the date that the Commission received the interpretation or enforcement petition. The response shall be served on all telecommunications carriers that are parties to the approved agreement.
All responses to the interpretation or enforcement petition shall include, at a minimum:
The name, address, and main telephone number of the responding carrier;

The name, title, business address, telephone number, fax number, and e-mail address (if available) of the person(s) who will be representing the responding carrier during the interpretation or enforcement proceeding;
A statement of any disputed issues, if different from those stated in the interpretation or enforcement petition;
A statement outlining the positions of each party to the approved agreement regarding the disputed issues, if different from those stated in the interpretation or enforcement petition;
All relevant documentation that supports the responding carrier’s position concerning the disputed issues;
A statement as to whether the responding carrier requests an evidentiary hearing; and
A certificate of service attesting that a copy of the response and all supporting documentation has been served on all other parties to the interpretation or enforcement proceeding.
